page.title: 05APPLETON ROEBUCK LAND USE
page.content: The heavy clay{soil}needs artificial drainage to prevent waterlogging.It is good quality & is farmed intensively. { Crops:}wheat,barley, oilseed rape, hay,vegetables,potatoes & sugarbeet. {Fields}are large & bear no relation -ship to the O.S.map.They are hedged with hawthorn which is uniform in height and thickness. There are a few fields still to be modernised. There is{fattening}of pigs,bullocks & lambs bought in at Murton Market, but no poultry are now kept. {Grain}is sold to breweries ,some for seed corn & some for milling.Oilseed rape is a relatively new crop that is sold for milling as an animal feed. Sugarbeet is sent to the British Sugar Corporation,works at Acomb. There is little waste land.Small woods are used to rear game.There is no commercial fruit growing.
